hiragana wo tsukau hito ga imasu. Ee sorekara desu ne, hontachi tokka, inanimate
object ni wa, konno tachi wa tsukawanai de kudasai.
Dewa, tsugi no kanji desu. Ee kono kanji desu keredomo, imi wa warm.

De, kono paato (part), kono radical, ee mo
minna mo shitte masu ne, water.

Ee soshite kono paato (part), sun. Ee soshite kono kanji nandesu keredomo, kono
paato (part), kore by itself, plate, sara desu.

So if you put the water on the plate under
the sun the water becomes warm.

So the whole thing meaning wa warm. No imi desu. De, eeto yomikata nandesu keredomo, onyomi
de wa on.

Tatoeba, ondo, temperature. Sorekara, kion, kore wa air no imi ga arimasu
kara, air temperature.

Sorekara taion, kore kara desu yo ne, body
temperature.

Sorekara, kore, ondokei, ee ondo. Kore temperature desu keredomo, kono kanji,
kore hakaru, to measure no imi ga arimasu.

So, thermometer no imi desu. Ee, ato, ee minna ga daisuki na onsen, hot
spring.
Ato, ondan na, mild. Konna tsukaikata ga arimasu. Ee, kunyomi nan desu keredomo, atata.

Ee, kore mo ee transitive intransitive no contrast
ga arimasu.
Tatoeba, nani nani wo atatameru. Kore wa transitive. Suupu (soup) wo atatamete kudasai.

Sorekara, nani nani ga atatamaru, kore wa
intransitive desu. Suupu (soup) ga atatamarimashita.

Ato, ma, adjective de atatakai, warm, desu
yo ne. Mou jyuunigatsu ni haitta kedo, atatakai desu
ne.
Konna tsukaikata ga arimasu.

Hai. Dewa tsugi no kanji desu. Ee, kono kanji desu kedo, imi wa to perceive
sorekara to remember.

Awake to iu imi mo arimasu. De, eeto kono paato (part) nan desu keredomo,
ue no paato (part) kore, kore manabu desu ne.

To learn, gakkou no gaku nandesu keredomo. So, learn. Soshite, kono naka shita no tokoro wa miru,
to watch desu ne.

So you learn something through watching. So it’s perceive, or remember to iu imi
nan desu keredomo.

Yomikata, ee, onyomi wa kaku to iu no yomikata
ga arimasu.
Tatoeba, kankaku, sense, sensation. Ee sorekara kakugo suru.

Ee kore to prepare, be ready to iu youna imi
nan desu keredomo. Ato jigakusuru, to become aware of oneself.
De, kunyomi no hou kore wa oboeru. EE, tatoeba kono kanji wo oboete imasu.

I remember this kanji. Mochiron, ano oboete kudasai te ma, memorize
this kanji to iu imi ni mo arimasu.

Sorekara, sameru, samasu. Kore mata intransitive sorekara transitive
no pair nandesu keredomo.
Sameru, kore wa intransitive. Me ga samemashita.

I got up, I woke up to iu imi desu. Ee sorekara, me wo samasu, kore ga, eeto ma,
I woke up nan desu keredomo,
tatoeba, me wo samashite kudasai. Wake up to iu, konna tsukaikata mo arimasu.

Ato, minna ga yoku shitteiru mezamashi tokei,
kono kanji wo kakimasu.

Hai. Dewa tsugi no kanji desu. Ee kono kanji desukeredo mo, imi wa explain,
theory, sorekara opinion konna imi ga arimasu.

De, eeto kono radical desu keredomo, mou shitte
masu minna, kore wa ano, language ni ee language

sore kara speaking ni kankei ga shita mono
nan desu keredomo. So you can imagine someone with a big mouth
talking and explaining or expressing his theory

or opinion, konna imi desu. De, eeto yomikata nan desu keredomo, ee, onyomi
de setsu, sorekara
zei to iu yomikata ga arun desukeredo mo. Tatoeba, setsumei suru, to explain.
Sorekara, settoku suru, to persuade. Enzetsu suru, kore wa to give a speech.

Sorekara shousetsu, kore wa novel. Li desu ne. Shousetsuka, kore wa
shousetsu wo kaku hito.
Ee sorekara kasetsu, hypothesis. Konna tsukaikata mo arimasu.

Ee, kunyomi nan desu keredomo, amari tsukawanai
katto omoun desukeredo mo, toku to iu, kore

ma to explain nan desu keredomo, ee, chotto
tokubetsu na ii kata nan desu keredomo, ma

bukkyou ga toku oshie, the teaching the Buddhism
explain, aruiwa persuade, sonna imi desu.

Hai. Dewa, resson (lesson) no ichi no saigo no
last character of lesson 1.
Ee, kono kanji desukeredo mo, imi wa choose. Sorekara, elect no imi ga arimasu.

De, eeto, kono paato (part) nan desu keredomo,
kono kanji by itself actually means individual.

So, you see two people, shita kono paato (part)
nan desu keredomo, kore tomo ni, together

no imi ga arimasu. So two people together going to the market
and choosing which goods to select,

sonna imi desu. Desu ga. So
the whole thing means to choose. Aruiwa elect no imi desu.
De yomikata nan desu keredomo, onyomi de sen. Tatoeba sentaku suru, to choose.
Senkou suru, ee select. Sorekara tousen suru, kore wa to be elected.
Ato, senkyou, election desu yo ne, daitouryou senkyou.
Daitouryou tte iu no wa president. So daitouryou no senkyou no imi desu.

Sorekara, senshuu.
Kore wa player. Yakyuu no senshuu, orinpikku (Olympic) no
senshuu, konna tsukaikata ga arimasu.
Kunyomi wa erabu, ee nani nani wo erabu. Transitive verb desu.
Tatoeba, suki na mono wo erande kudasai. Choose whatever you like.
Konna tsukaikata desu.
